definition: Milton (name)/John Milton (1608-1674), English republican writer and poet, author of Paradise Lost
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: However no tricks were necessary for the surfing scenes because Hamilton herself did the breathtaking wave riding.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這些衝浪的場景都是由漢米爾頓親自上陣的。

sentences.english: The Nativity for Milton is purely an anticipatory event.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕清晨歌》這首詩對米爾頓來說就是一個預言。

sentences.english: In Milton's case this investment in power paid off.
sentences.chinese: 米爾頓對力量的投資獲得了報償。

sentences.english: By all accounts, Milton has just made this up in his letter to Diodati.
sentences.chinese: 人們都認爲這是米爾頓在他給迪奧達蒂的信中編造的。

sentences.english: He can be called upon in fact exactly as he is by Lady Mary here.
sentences.chinese: 正如這裏瑪麗夫人援引米爾頓一樣。
米爾頓的名聲總是將他本身掩蓋。

sentences.english: One of the fallen angels in Milton's Paradise Lost.
sentences.chinese: 鬼王米爾頓作品失樂園中墮落天使之一。

sentences.english: By the end of his life, though, Milton would in effect try to rewrite everything.
sentences.chinese: 但到米爾頓生命的最後，他其實是想重寫一切的。

sentences.english: In 2003, Bethany Hamilton, 13, lost her left arm to a shark attack while surfing off Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 2003年，13歲的漢米爾頓在衝浪時被鯊魚襲擊。

definition: Dole (name)/Bob Dole (1923-), US Republican politician, Kansas senator 1969-1996
Nelson or Nillson (name)/Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), British naval hero
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
